thread.title: High schools: Barnstable field hockey makes playoffs
thread.title_full: High schools: Barnstable field hockey makes playoffs

author: Cape Cod Times sports@capecodonline.com
title: High schools: Barnstable field hockey makes playoffs
text: Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 10:25 PM Updated at 10:26 PM » Social News HYANNIS -- Five days after handing the Falmouth Clippers a 4-1 field hockey loss on their home turf, the Barnstable Red Raiders were unwilling to go down in their house. Senior captain Caroline Spalt knocked home her second goal of the game, carrying the ball into the circle and firing it home with six minutes to play to help Barnstable edge Falmouth, 4-3, on Monday in Hyannis. The Red Raiders (8-4-1) also clinched a berth in the South Sectional tournament with the win. Falmouth's Ericka Meissner broke a 1-1 halftime tie just two minutes after the break on a breakaway. Spalt finished off an assist from Meaghan Moore three minutes later to retie the game, 2-2. Beatriz DaSilva put Barnstable on top with 15 minutes to play, with Meissner scoring another breakaway to equalize roughly three minutes later. Spalt’s second goal then put the Red Raiders on top for good. Freshman Quinn O’Rourke broke the ice for Falmouth (5-4-3) eight minutes into the game off a penalty corner. Moore finished off a pass from senior Amanda Piknick two minutes later to knot things at 1-1. Nauset 6, Sturgis East 0: Playing one of its best games of the season, the Warriors were unkind visitors to the Storm as they rolled to a win at the Simpkins School Field in South Yarmouth. Five different Nauset (5-8-1, 0-5 ACL) players tallied goals, led by a two-goal, three-assist game from junior captain Mackenzie Meads. Michaela Donlon added a goal and an assist, as did Megan Jusell. Both Polly Watson and Melissa Ednie each scored solo goals. Kait Smith had 24 saves for Sturgis East (0-7), while Toni Powicki was strong at sweeper for the Storm. Dennis-Yarmouth 3, Sandwich 0: The Dolphins clinched a playoff berth and at least a tie for the Atlantic Coast league title by virtue of their whitewash of the Blue Knights in East Sandwich. Relying on a solid effort by the defense, which limited host Sandwich (10-2-1) to just three shots on goal. D-Y ( 9-3-1, 6-1-1 ACL) pounced on the Knights early, scoring the game’s first goal at the 7:37 mark of the opening half when Natalie Reid converted a Taylor Conley pass into a goal. Just over 20 minutes later, Shelby Dunn made it a 2-0 game with an unassisted score. The Dolphins added the insurance goal halfway through the second half when Conley took a pass from Anna McGaffigan and sent it home. Old Rochester 2, Bourne 0: The Canalmen came out flat and never inflated the rest of the game as they were blanked by the Bulldogs in Mattapoisett. After qualifying for the tournament Friday, it appears that there was a carryover effect that kept the Bourne (9-5-1) crew from rising to the occasion of Monday’s game. Cited for a decent game for the Canalmen was Audrey kelleher. GIRLS VOLLEYBALL Bourne 3, Case 2: Strong communication and key offense from seniors Miranda Partosan and Nicole Gresh led the Canalmen over the Cardinals, 21-25, 25-23, 13-25, 25-21, 15-12 in Bourne. Partosan and Gresh dominated the Bourne (13-3, 11-3 South Coast Conference) outside attack game, with 14 and 12 kills respectively. Gresh added six aces and 10 digs. Aly Hickey spread the offense around with 37 assists while Leah Hidenfelter was huge defensively with 29 digs. St. John Paul II 3, Upper Cape 0: Kaia Whiteley had nine kills, an ace and a block to lead the Lions past the Rams in Bourne. St. John Paul II won 25-21, 25-23, 25-18. Shannon Clifford had four kills, three aces and a dig for SJP II (9-8), which needs one win its final three matches to make the playoffs. Jillian Lizotte led UCT (8-8) with 16 service points and an ace, followed by Molly Horn with 12 service points, an ace along and five digs. Sandwich 3, Sturgis West 2: A game Navigator squad made the host Blue Knights work hard to collect a win in East Sandwich. Sandwich won with scores of 25-12, 25-12, 23-25, 24-26, 15-6. Junior Caroline Clabault led the offense for the Blue Knights (12-3) with 25 kills. Senior Tessa Wood added 14. Ashlynne McNally was key for Sturgis West (3-8) with four kills and three blocks. Lydia Brox chipped in with six assists and Althea Turley added eight digs and strong defense for the Navigators, who are back in action Thursday hosting Upper Cape. Dartmouth 3, Falmouth 0: Natalie Gagnon had six blocks and Hunter Engstrom fired off 10 kills, but the Clippers still fell to the Indians in straight sets in East Falmouth. Dartmouth won 25-15, 25-17, 25-21. Falmouth (1-13) returns to Atlantic Coast League action today at home against Sandwich. By Cape Cod Times
